name: Noman Nooruddin Vadsariya
title: AI Engineer & Full-Stack Developer
summary: Graduate student in Computer Science at USC focusing on AI and scalable ML systems. Previously worked as a Software Engineer at Securiti.ai, handling large-scale structured and unstructured data for content classification, and as an AI R&D intern at Motive, building automated ML pipelines and real-time AI systems with RAG workflows.

highlights: Enhanced backend performance by 15% by developing and refactoring RESTful APIs in Go, and optimizing PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch queries to handle large-scale data efficiently.
Designed and deployed scalable microservices with asynchronous workers for data export, scanning, and classification, which increased system throughput and reliability under heavy workloads.

Led the development of content classification features, including the Validation Workbench and Agentic AI automation, enabling systematic tuning, validation, and monitoring of classifier results, improving accuracy and consistency across datasets.
Took ownership of testing across multiple features, implementing unit, performance, and integration tests to ensure robust production deployments.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to define feature requirements, troubleshoot complex bugs, and optimize service reliability for enterprise-level clients.
Conducted performance benchmarking and profiling to identify bottlenecks, applying caching strategies and query optimizations that reduced latency in high-volume pipelines.
Built and optimized 20+ RESTful APIs using FastAPI and Flask to serve real-time dashcam AI inferences, reducing latency by 30% and improving response times for AI-driven applications.
Architected end-to-end MLOps pipelines using Apache Airflow for orchestration and Kubeflow for model training and deployment, automating retraining workflows for three core AI models.
Collaborated with data scientists and engineers to implement real-time monitoring, logging, and alerting for deployed AI models, ensuring reliability and maintainability.
Developed automated model evaluation pipelines to track performance metrics across Dev, QA, and Production environments, enabling continuous improvement.

Mentored 50+ students through hands-on labs and office hours, improving understanding of recursion, tree/graph algorithms, and dynamic programming.

projects.title: Dense Video Captioning
projects.description: Built an end-to-end pipeline to generate timestamped captions for long-form video content. The system uses OpenCV for video frame extraction, PyTorch for a transformer-based sequence-to-sequence model, and temporal attention to focus on relevant video segments.
impact: Improved content accessibility by providing context-rich captions, making videos usable for automated indexing, summarization, and for users with hearing impairments.
Generated highly accurate captions that increased BLEU score by 12%, improving automated content understanding for large datasets.
learnings: Gained experience in temporal modeling, transformer architectures, and handling large video datasets efficiently.
Learned the importance of data preprocessing, temporal alignment, and robust evaluation metrics for video understanding tasks.
Understood the challenges of integrating machine learning models into end-to-end production pipelines.

projects.title: Khudmadad Freelancing Platform
projects.description: Developed a full-stack freelancing web app using .NET backend, React frontend, and PostgreSQL database. Implemented secure APIs, real-time messaging, and role-based access control. Deployed a plugin for external websites to expand accessibility.
impact: Platform successfully facilitated user interaction between freelancers and clients.
The plugin gained 2,000+ downloads and an average rating of 4/5 stars, demonstrating adoption and usability.
learnings: Strengthened understanding of full-stack development, API design, and user authentication/authorization.
Learned to handle real-time communication, data consistency, and error handling in production systems.
Understood deployment challenges and importance of CI/CD pipelines for reliability.

projects.title: Credit Risk Prediction & Fraud Detection
projects.description: Built a dataset of 100,000+ loan applications and transactions. Trained gradient boosting and transformer-based models in TensorFlow to predict credit risk and detect fraud. Deployed a real-time scoring system using Flask and Kafka.
impact: Improved risk detection in loan processing with 91% precision and 87% recall.
Real-time predictions helped decision-making teams act faster, reducing potential financial losses.
learnings: Learned the practical application of RAG workflows to integrate historical data for explainable AI.
Understood challenges in handling imbalanced datasets, feature engineering, and maintaining production-ready ML pipelines.
Strengthened skills in distributed inference and real-time system integration.

projects.title: Cross-Platform Sentiment Analysis of Movie Reviews
projects.description: Collected reviews from IMDB, Rotten Tomatoes, and Twitter, preprocessed text, and trained BERT-based transformer models for sentiment classification. Deployed a real-time inference system using Flask to visualize sentiment trends.
impact: Provided real-time insights on sentiment trends across multiple platforms, enabling better analysis for media or marketing purposes.
Showcased ability to scale NLP models for diverse and noisy datasets.
learnings: Gained expertise in transformer fine-tuning, text preprocessing, and handling cross-platform textual data.
Learned best practices for deploying NLP models in a lightweight, real-time environment.
Understood trade-offs between model size, accuracy, and inference speed for production use.
